output:
[FINDING]
Category: formatting_issue
Severity: minor
Line: 3
Quote: "[I'm unsure how much this rehashes things 'everyone knows already' - if old hat, feel free to downvote into oblivion. My other motivation for the [cross-post](http://www.thepolemicalmedic.com/2014/07/tails-come-apart/) is the hope it might catch the interest of someone with a stronger mathematical background who could make this line of argument more robust]"
Issue: Bracket escaping is inconsistent - uses backslash escaping for opening bracket but not closing bracket
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: formatting_issue
Severity: minor
Line: 5
Quote: "[Edit 2014/11/14: mainly adjustments and rewording in light of the many helpful comments below (thanks!). I've also added a geometric explanation.]"
Issue: Bracket escaping is inconsistent - uses backslash escaping for opening bracket but not closing bracket
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: formatting_issue
Severity: minor
Line: 7
Quote: "to chance of [being imprisoned](http://www.sagepub.com/schram/study/materials/reference/90851_04.2r.pdf), to[ lifespan](http://www.bmj.com/content/322/7290/819)."
Issue: Missing space between "to" and "[lifespan]" in the link formatting
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: formatting_issue
Severity: minor
Line: 9
Quote: "the very highest earners tend[ to be very smart](http://infoproc.blogspot.co.uk/2009/11/if-youre-so-smart-why-arent-you-rich.html)"
Issue: Missing space between "tend" and link bracket
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: formatting_issue
Severity: minor
Line: 21
Quote: "[Inspired by [this essay](http://www.megasociety.org/noesis/149/iq&pear.html) from Grady Towers]"
Issue: Bracket escaping is inconsistent - uses backslash escaping for opening bracket but not closing bracket
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: spelling_grammar
Severity: minor
Line: 23
Quote: "comparing the speed of a ball out of a baseball pitchers hand compared to its speed crossing crossing the plate"
Issue: Word "crossing" is duplicated
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: spelling_grammar
Severity: minor
Line: 15
Quote: "Maybe although having a faster serve is better all things being equal, but focusing too heavily"
Issue: Awkward grammar - "Maybe although" construction is unclear, should be either "Maybe having" or "Although having"
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: formatting_issue
Severity: minor
Line: 83
Quote: "There may be spread betting or portfolio scenarios where this factor comes into play - perhaps instead of funding AMF to diminishing returns when its marginal effectiveness dips below charity #2, we should be willing to spread funds sooner.(6)"
Issue: Footnote reference "(6)" appears to be duplicated - there's already a footnote 6 in line 75
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: structural_problem
Severity: major
Line: 85
Quote: "---"
Issue: Footnotes section uses only horizontal rule separator without clear section heading, making it unclear these are footnotes
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: formatting_issue
Severity: minor
Line: 99
Quote: "6. Another intuitive dividend is that this makes it clear why you can by R-squared"
Issue: Missing word - should be "multiply by R-squared" or similar verb
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: broken_references
Severity: major
Line: 57
Quote: "So, [_ceteris paribus_](/lw/km6/why_the_tails_come_apart/b8ph)"
Issue: Internal reference link appears to be a LessWrong-specific URL that may not work in other contexts
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: broken_references
Severity: major
Line: 89
Quote: "As [nshepperd notes below](/lw/km6/why_the_tails_come_apart/b6j4)"
Issue: Internal reference link appears to be a LessWrong-specific URL that may not work in other contexts
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: broken_references
Severity: major
Line: 89
Quote: "as suggested by [homunq](/lw/km6/why_the_tails_come_apart/b6hs)"
Issue: Internal reference link appears to be a LessWrong-specific URL that may not work in other contexts
[/FINDING]

[FINDING]
Category: broken_references
Severity: major
Line: 71
Quote: "[here](/lw/foa/should_correlation_coefficients_be_expressed_as/)"
Issue: Internal reference link appears to be a LessWrong-specific URL that may not work in other contexts
